Speaker: sheriff
Dialogue: What's going on, Adams?

Speaker: deputy adams
Dialogue: Twenty kids live at this orphanage, Sheriff. All twenty have gone missing.

Speaker: sister clara
Dialogue: After the power went out, I went to check on the children. But their beds were empty. Every one of them. They just disappeared...

Speaker: deputy adams
Dialogue: Are you okay, son? Are the other kids around here?

Speaker: young edward
Dialogue: I don't know... I don't remember...

Speaker: deputy adams
Dialogue: Why don't we start with your name? Do you remember your name?

Speaker: young edward
Dialogue: Edward... Edward Carnby.

Speaker: small boy
Dialogue: Did you have a nightmare?

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: Your mother is wrong. Being afraid of the dark is what keeps most of us alive.

Speaker: small boy
Dialogue: Everybody else tells me not to be afraid.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: That's because they don't know the truth.

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: You travel light.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: Trust me, I'm carrying enough baggage for the both of us.

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: That's pretty funny, man. What do you do?

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: You really want to know?

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: Yeah, man. Hearing about my passengers' lives keeps the job interesting.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: I'm a paranormal investigator.

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: Get the fuck outta here!

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: I'm an effective solution to unusual problems.

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: No shit? Want me to lose him?

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: If you can...

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: I'm trapped, man!

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: I'll draw him away...

Speaker: beat cop
Dialogue: Hey!

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Got another delivery, Ms. Cedrac.

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: I don't have anything scheduled. What museum was it transferred from?

Speaker: delivery guy
Dialogue: For Dr. Hudgens, from Dr. Hudgens.

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: It's probably an error. It must be for the big Abkani show.

Speaker: delivery guy
Dialogue: Abkani? What the hell's Abkani?

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Ancient Native American civilization. They were this super-advanced culture, but something like ten thousand years ago, they just disappeared.

Speaker: line
Dialogue: You've been reading up.

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Not much else to do around here at night.

Speaker: delivery guy
Dialogue: Says here it's not to be opened by anyone but Dr. Hudgens.

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: This is Aline Cedrac. She's the assistant curator.

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: We've got Abkani artifacts coming in from museums around the world. Until Hudgens gets back, I'm doing all the cataloguing anyway.

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Where is Hudgens anyway? The show opens in a few days.

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: Off on another archeological goosechase. He thinks he's finally found the Erebus.

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: So he sticks you with the work. At least it keeps your mind off your boyfriend.

Speaker: line
Dialogue: I'll be in my office if you need me.

Speaker: delivery guy
Dialogue: What was that all about?

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Damn it... I shouldn't have said that. Her boyfriend's been missing for the last three months.

Speaker: delivery guy
Dialogue: Nice going, jack-ass.

Speaker: captain chernick
Dialogue: They say a sunken ship is like a grave. It should never be disturbed.

Speaker: hudgens
Dialogue: I've been searching for the Erebus for twenty years, Captain. Now that I've found it, I'm afraid your ill-informed superstitions aren't enough to stop me.

Speaker: hudgens
Dialogue: Bring it up.

Speaker: captain chernick
Dialogue: Don't you want to open it? Make sure it's what you're looking for?

Speaker: hudgens
Dialogue: The conditions must be perfect. Otherwise, there will be... consequences.

Speaker: captain chernick
Dialogue: Is this made of solid gold?

Speaker: hudgens
Dialogue: Did you know the Abkani were the first civilization to use gold for their valuables? They believed it held the power to contain evil spirits. Thousands of years later, we don't even remember why gold was valuable to us in the first place. Now, let's load it onto the truck.

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: The pictograms are late-period Abkani. It seems to be some sort of... prophecy. Shadows that make ghosts of men. The world of light consumed by darkness. This is the first indication I've ever seen that the Abkani had a myth about the end of the world.

Speaker: captain chernick
Dialogue: If the container's made of gold, whatever's inside must be worth a fortune.

Speaker: hudgens
Dialogue: You have no idea...

Speaker: captain chernick
Dialogue: But I'm looking forward to finding out.

Speaker: hudgens
Dialogue: I suppose one should not be surprised when mercenaries act mercenary.

Speaker: captain chernick
Dialogue: The only mistake would be letting you walk out with whatever's in there. Barnes...

Speaker: hudgens
Dialogue: Captain! Don't open it!

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: John?

Speaker: hudgens
Dialogue: They're faster than I thought...

Speaker: captain chernick
Dialogue: Kill him.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: his better be good, Miles.

Speaker: agent miles
Dialogue: Sir, we're getting some strange readings in the control room.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: his is Bureau 713. "Strange" doesn't even crack my radar. Now what's the situation?

Speaker: agent miles
Dialogue: Well, sir, normal levels of paranormal activity range from three to five...

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: condescending) Yes Miles. And what level are the sensors picking up now?

Speaker: agent miles
Dialogue: We don't know.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: What are we looking at, Krashinsky?

Speaker: krash
Dialogue: Electromagnetics off the scale, Commander.

Speaker: agent yonek
Dialogue: Recalibrating sensors now, sir.

Speaker: sister clara
Dialogue: Still having trouble sleeping, Edward? You can't stay up all night, you know.

Speaker: young edward
Dialogue: Sister, something's happened.

Speaker: sister clara
Dialogue: What is it, Edward?

Speaker: young edward
Dialogue: They're not gone anymore. The others are back.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: Hello?

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: Linda, what's wrong?

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: I'll figure this out, Linda. I'll find John.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Edward... you've known each other since you were kids. Did he... did he tell you he was leaving me?

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: Of course not.

Speaker: linda
Dialogue: Then where is he, Edward? What's going on?

Speaker: sister clara
Dialogue: Welcome home, Edward.

Speaker: sophie
Dialogue: Should I make some tea?

Speaker: sister clara
Dialogue: Yes. Thank you, Sophie.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: Sister... John disappeared last night. And something happened to me as well.

Speaker: sister clara
Dialogue: It's happening again.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: I need your help, Sister. I need to find the others.

Speaker: sister clara
Dialogue: I'll get their files.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: I'll let you know as soon as I hear something.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: Why did I agree to this?

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: I ordered for you, Fischer. It's pecan.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: You've got a good memory, Carnby.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: That means all nineteen are missing.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: I ran full cross-references. Nothing much in common between them. Except they all grew up in the same orphanage. Your orphanage. What's going on, Carnby?

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: That's what I'm trying to find out.

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: Hello?

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: It's a fascinating piece, Dr. Hudgens. I started decoding the pictograms and...

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: I was only going to catalogue it for you.

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: But, Dr. Hudgens, I was just...

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: There's... somebody here to see you.

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: Edward...

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: I missed you too.

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: I thought you were dead, you asshole!

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: Aline... let me explain. In private.

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: Give me one reason why I'd ever want to speak to you again?

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: Five minutes, Aline. I'll tell you everything.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: I was in the Amazon for six weeks, tracking poachers through their transport lines. Then I fell in with a group of ex- Chilean military selling artifacts on the black-market. This was found in a gold mine in the southern tip of Chile.

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: And how did you end up with it?

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: I asked very nicely.

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: You should've called, Edward. Or written. Just to let me know you were alive.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: Does it make any sense to you?

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: Yesterday, maybe not. But something happened last night.

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: They were found in completely different locations. Alaska. Newfoundland. Venezuela. And now this one's from Chile.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: Ten thousand years ago, it would've been like burying them at the ends of the earth.

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: The Abkani's written language is based on pictograms. Combinations of symbols to create different meanings. But there's one here I've never seen before.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: You're not trying to seduce me, are you?

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: Give me that.

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: Hairs on the back of my neck just stood up.

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: How come every time you show up, my life gets complicated?

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: I could ask you the same thing.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: I think we'd better run...

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: Can't hold it...

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: No! Why didn't you ask me that before you pushed me in here?

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: Those doors lead to the front entrance.

Speaker: agent barr
Dialogue: Reading two xenos.

Speaker: agent cheung
Dialogue: There!

Speaker: agent barr
Dialogue: Cheung! Marko! Don't let them get away!

Speaker: krash
Dialogue: Readings gone. You lost them, Barr.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: I want a full security sweep. Miles, get Fischer to send his sci-and-spy boys down here. Now go.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: hat the hell are you doing here, Carnby?

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: Hey Richie.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: It's Commander Burke. This is my unit.

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: They saved our lives.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: You used to be able to take care of yourself, Carnby. Gotten soft since you left 713?

Speaker: agent miles
Dialogue: Ms. Cedrac, I'm Agent Miles. This is Commander Burke.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Aline Cedrac. Pleasure to meet you. How's the Ph.D. coming along?

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: It's fine. Thanks.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Miles, get her to a medic.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: I'll catch up.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Why am I still looking at you?

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: I need to know what those things are.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: That information's classified. If you were still an agent, you'd already know. But since you're not, stay out of my way.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: I'm asking nicely.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Get him out of here!

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: You're right, Commander. I guess I have gone soft.

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: I want to finish studying those artifacts.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: I need to find out what's happened to John and the others. Stay in contact. We'll meet up later.

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: Commander, I need to get to my office.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: The museum's quarantined until we're done.

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: At least let me pack up my work. There's priceless artifacts in there. If they get damaged...

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: If you notice anything out of the ordinary, let me know immediately.

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: I don't think I want to know your definition of out of the ordinary.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: You shouldn't be here, Carnby.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: I'm not here. Commander Burke is. Now what the hell is that thing inside him?

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: Your curiosity have anything to do with the fingerprint of yours I found on his corpse?

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: The list of people I trust is short, Fischer. Is it about to get shorter?

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: Yeah, we got dentals. Agent James

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: He was an agent? When?

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: Went MIA twenty years ago. Presumed dead. I'm trying to get more intell, but his records are so classified, they're practically invisible. C arnby takes the tongs from Fischer, holding open the skin. Fischer makes a series of incisions with the scalpel, disconnecting the spinal-worm from Pinkerton's spine.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: It's fused with his nervous system.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: I've never seen this kind of symbiosis before.

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: Dr. Hudgens. When did you get back?

Speaker: hudgens
Dialogue: A few hours ago. I heard there was some excitement. Are you alright?

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: I'm fine. A bit shaken up. But fine.

Speaker: hudgens
Dialogue: I apologize for snapping at you earlier. Now, what are you still doing here after all you've been through?

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: Edward.

Speaker: hudgens
Dialogue: This is a major find. I'll need to analyze it. Confirm its authenticity.

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: I can do that myself.

Speaker: hudgens
Dialogue: That wasn't a request...

Speaker: hudgens
Dialogue: And you are?

Speaker: agent cheung
Dialogue: Ms. Cedrac's security detail.

Speaker: hudgens
Dialogue: My dear, do you have any idea who I...

Speaker: agent cheung
Dialogue: Dr. Lionel Hudgens. Former agent, sci-and- spy division. Currently 713 advisor status. I know exactly who you are. But I'm not your "dear" anything.

Speaker: hudgens
Dialogue: I'll just have to hold off my curiosity until morning.

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: Dr. Hudgens... I forgot to ask. Did you find the Erebus this time?

Speaker: hudgens
Dialogue: Just an empty shipwreck. You were right. It was another wild goosechase.

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: Since when do I have a security detail?

Speaker: agent cheung
Dialogue: Since it seemed like you needed it.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: There's one inside you too. But the symbiosis is incomplete.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: Can you remove it?

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: I could try. But it might paralyze you.

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: What's missing...

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: I'm not much for coincidences. These organisms must be connected to those things from the museum.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: We call them xenomorphs.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: Catchy. When did they first appear?

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: Two years ago. They've been 713's top priority ever since. But it's been almost exclusively in rural areas. This kind of urban infiltration is unprecedented.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: Have you isolated any weaknesses?

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: Most metals pass right through them. So normal bullets and blades are useless. But they're vulnerable to elements 76 to 79. Osmium, iridium, platinum, and gold. Negates their ability to disrupt electricity.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: If they disrupt electricity, why did my flashlight still work?

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: The closer the current to its power source, the less disruption.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: I'm going to need a lot of those.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: Five minutes...

Speaker: line
Dialogue: Edward?

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Have you been meeting with Carnby?

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: Yes. He's got intell we need. And I trust him.

Speaker: urke
Dialogue: We've got to trust each other, Fischer. Are you with us or not?

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: All the intell you've got on Edward Carnby.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: What else could I do? I had to tell him.

Speaker: sarah fischer
Dialogue: You did the right thing, Paul. From what you've told me, Carnby can take care of himself.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: Sarah? Answer me! Sarah!

Speaker: hudgens
Dialogue: If you can't beat us, Fischer, join us.

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: Something smells amazing.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: I know.

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: I figured out a connection with the symbols on those artifacts. They correspond to constellations. But something's missing.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: Maybe this will help...

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: Can you run the program on this?

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: What are we looking for?

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: The Abkani used constellations to pin- point a geographical location. But I don't think I can isolate it closer than a hundred mile radius.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: Yeah. That's us right there.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: John?

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: That looked like John.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: It is. The other two are from the orphanage as well.

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: You had no choice.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: Something's controlling them.

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: How many are there altogether?

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: Twenty. Including me.

Speaker: krash
Dialogue: Multiple readings confirmed. Back-up's on the way.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: Aline!

Speaker: agent barr
Dialogue: We're clear, sir.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Love what you've done with the place, Carnby.

Speaker: agent miles
Dialogue: Sir, this one's infected too!

Speaker: agent turner
Dialogue: Got another one here!

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Drop your weapon and get down on the ground.

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: What are you doing?

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: He's been infected with some kind of organism. He could be under its control.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: It's true. I've got one inside me. But it's not controlling me.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: You'll excuse me if I don't take your word for it. Now drop your weapon.

Speaker: agent turner
Dialogue: Get out of the way!

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: He's not one of them.

Speaker: urke
Dialogue: If I've got to shoot through you to get to him, I'll do it.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: Why are the lights still out?

Speaker: agent barr
Dialogue: Scanner's clear.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Forget to pay your power bill, Carnby?

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: What does Hudgens have to do with this?

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: That's what I want to find out. I need you both to brief me in the air.

Speaker: krash
Dialogue: We're practically off the scale, Commander. This is unprecedented. Should I initiate Contingency Nine-Alpha?

Speaker: krash
Dialogue: Is that a negative, Commander?

Speaker: agent miles
Dialogue: We've got three perimeters of flash- mines. Gatling guns are set to electromagnetic motion tracking. And every available agent in the vicinity is here. But Commander...

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: I know, Miles. But back-up won't make it before sunrise.

Speaker: agent turner
Dialogue: Generator will be on-line shortly, sir.

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: It looks like you're going to war.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: We are. The highest xeno concentration on record is closing in on this location. This could be our chance to wipe them out once and for all.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: We need to go down there.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: They're coming here for a reason. Until we know what they're after, we're never really going to be able to stop them.

Speaker: agent miles
Dialogue: Something's definitely down there, sir. But there's too much interference to get a clear reading from here.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Goddamn it. Miles, you're in charge of perimeter defense. Nothing gets in or out until we find out what's down there.

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: I've been thinking about something. The Abkani prophecy. The shadows that make ghosts of men...

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: Every culture has a story about the end of the world.

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: But not every story starts to come true.

Speaker: agent barr
Dialogue: It's definitely this way, sir.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: It's a dead end.

Speaker: agent barr
Dialogue: Readings are getting stronger.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: We'll double-back. Take another tunnel.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: Wait. Aline, look at this...

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: They're Abkani.

Speaker: agent cheung
Dialogue: There's more over here.

Speaker: agent barr
Dialogue: What do you got, Marko?

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: We've got to get down there.

Speaker: agent feenstra
Dialogue: How long do we have to hold them?

Speaker: agent miles
Dialogue: Only until dawn.

Speaker: agent feenstra
Dialogue: Sir... that's four hours away.

Speaker: agent miles
Dialogue: I know.

Speaker: agent miles
Dialogue: Incoming!

Speaker: agent miles
Dialogue: Where the hell are the lights?

Speaker: agent turner
Dialogue: The generator's not coming on-line. They must be disrupting it.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: Aline!

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Cheung! Cut the line!

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: It's a warning.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: Subtle.

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: The gist of it is, even if you make it down here alive, you're already dead.

Speaker: agent miles
Dialogue: Hold your fire until they're at the second perimeter.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: Aline!

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: We've got to get up there.

Speaker: gent turner
Dialogue: Hit it.

Speaker: agent feenstra
Dialogue: We made it, sir.

Speaker: agent turner
Dialogue: Fischer?

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: Maybe this is what they look like when they grow outside a human host?

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: I think you'd better see this.

Speaker: agent miles
Dialogue: Feenstra!

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: The Abkani didn't put this here.

Speaker: gent barr
Dialogue: There's no way through.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: There's always a way...

Speaker: agent feenstra
Dialogue: I'm out.

Speaker: agent miles
Dialogue: Last one.

Speaker: agent feenstra
Dialogue: I can't walk. If I lay down suppressing fire, maybe you can make it out of here.

Speaker: agent miles
Dialogue: I die fighting or I don't die at all.

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: You sure this is going to work?

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: What is this place?

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: This is where it happened.

Speaker: agent barr
Dialogue: Commander...

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: Edward, look...

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: So it's a key.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Two, we set enough C-4 to bury this place. Keep whatever's in there, down here for good.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: The answers I've been looking for my whole life could be in there.

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: Some doors are locked for a reason.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: Barr... how much C-4 you got left?

Speaker: agent barr
Dialogue: Enough to blow this place to...

Speaker: hudgens
Dialogue: I'm afraid I can't allow that.

Speaker: hudgens
Dialogue: Our early work was crude, I admit. But eventually we perfected the implant process. You were our last failure, Carnby. If you hadn't escaped, 713 never would've shut down the experiments. Burke's eyes flash with anger.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: Aline...

Speaker: hudgens
Dialogue: You couldn't have opened it anyway. Not without this...

Speaker: line
Dialogue: These doors won't hold them for long

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Once we get out, we can remote detonate.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: Look at the dust on the floor. This is where Hudgens got in.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: Over there!

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: The remote detonator's inactive. The signal can't get through.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: We'll find a way.

Speaker: urke
Dialogue: You saved my life, Carnby. I don't much like debts.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: Burke!

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: Edward... if he detonates those charges, we're all dead.

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: They were under us the whole time.

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: Where are all the children?

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: Something's very wrong...

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: Edward... what's going on?

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: Remember what Hudgens said? I was his last failure. He said he perfected the implant process.

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: It can't be...

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: Then where the hell is everybody? Where's everybody gone?

Speaker: aline
Dialogue: Yes Edward?

Speaker: carnby
Dialogue: It's going to be a busy day.
